imagedataset = ShopeeImageDataset(
    new_train['image'].values,
    transforms.Compose([
        transforms.RandomHorizontalFlip(),
        transforms.RandomVerticalFlip(),
        transforms.RandomRotation(20),
        transforms.Resize((512, 512)),
        transforms.ToTensor(),

source.6ccabaa8:
new_train = new_train.reset_index()
idx = 0
fig, ax = plt.subplots(10, 5, figsize=(20, 50))
for i in range(10):
    for j in range(5):
        ax[i, j].imshow(cv2.imread(new_train.image[idx]))
        idx += 1
plt.show()
source.93051ec6:
idx = 0
fig, ax = plt.subplots(10, 5, figsize=(20, 50))
for i in range(10):
    for j in range(5):
        ax[i, j].imshow(imagedataset[idx].transpose(0, 2))
        idx += 1
plt.show()
source.77603425: There are quite a lot of pics having the similar look. Using flip and rotation could make them different. This could be one of the way to generate data for training.
